gurmukhi: ibru`D kRu`D rwijXM ]n cwr pYr BwijXM ]
transliteration: Biruddh Kruddh Raajiyan|| Na Chaar Pair Bhaajiyan||
translation: Filled with anger, they move forward and do not go back even four feet.

gurmukhi: sMBwr ssqR gwjhI ]su nwd syG lwjhI ]16]
transliteration: Sanbhaar Sastra Gadj-hoo|| Su Naad Megh Laaj-hoo||16||
translation: They hold the weapons and challenge and hearing their thunder, the clouds feel shy.16.

transliteration: Halank Haak Maar-hoo|| Sarakk Sarakk Sastra Jhaar-hoo||
translation: They raise their heart-rending shouts and strike their weapons violently.

transliteration: Bhire Bidaar(i) Sokiyan|| Sidhaar Dev Lokiyan||17||
translation: They fight, forgetting all sorrows and several of them move towards heaven.17.

gurmukhi: irsy ibru`D bIrXM ]su mwir Jwir qIrXM ]
transliteration: Rise Biruddh Boorayan|| Su Daar(i) Jdaar(i) Toorayan||
translation: The warriors filled with ire and moving forward shoot a volley of arrows.

gurmukhi: sbd sMK b`ijXM ]su bIr DIr s`ijXM ]18]
transliteration: Sabad Sankh Bajjiyan|| Su Boor Dhoor Sajjiyan||18||
translation: The conch is blown and in such a terrible time, the warriors get adorned with patience. 18.

transliteration: Turoo Sankh Baaje|| Mahaa Boor Saaje||
translation: The trumpet and conch resound and the great warriors look impressive.

transliteration: Nache Tound Taajoo|| Mache Soor Gadjoo||19||
translation: The swift-running horses dance and the brave warriors are excited.19.
The glistening sharp swords flash like lightning.
The sound of drums arises and is heard continuously. 20.
Somewhere the double-edged swords and helmets lie broken, somewhere the warriors shout “kill, kill”.

transliteration: Dhakaa Dhook Dhakkan|| Gire Hack Bakkan||21||
translation: Somewhere the warriors are forcefully knocked about and somewhere, being puzzled, they have fallen down. 21.

transliteration: Dalan Dooh Gadhan|| Adho An Laahan||
translation: The great army is being trampled and limbs are being chopped into halves.
